fields.description:
When the 'People Directory' has been [disabled|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Hiding+the+People+Directory], any redirects to the the dashboard (e.g. by clicking on the 'People' link within the breadcrumbs when viewing a profile) result in the dashboard being displayed with the default site welcome message. This occurs even in the case where a custom site welcome message has been specified.

The PeopleDirectoryAction doBrowse() method returns an _ERROR_ result when the People Directory has been disabled. The dashboard rendering will attempt to display the custom site welcome message - but this object is not available on the PeopleDirectoryAction and hence reverts to the default message.
fields.summary: With the 'People Directory' disabled, redirects from 'People' links to the dashboard result in the default site welcome message being displayed at all times

fields.description:
Previewing page in Confluence does not work if Confluence's page is behind frame. If you have a long content which needs scroll bar to see the whole content, the preview wont display all the content because there is not scollbar. The problem does not happen on Confluence 2.2.10 but it does happen in the latest version. I have tested this problem against Confluence 2.10.2 and 2.10.3. In order to reproduce the problem, please follow the steps below:
# Create html page which contains the following:
{noformat}
<frameset>
   <frame src="http://localhost:8213/">
</frameset> 
{noformat}
# Start up Confluence version 2.10.3 (I presume that the port of it is 8213).
# Create a page contains the following:
{noformat}
| row 0| 
| row 1| 
| row 2| 
| row 3| 
| row 4| 
| row 5| 
| row 6| 
| row 7| 
| row 8| 
| row 9| 
| row 10| 
| row 11| 
| row 12| 
| row 13| 
| row 14| 
| row 15| 
| row 16| 
| row 17| 
| row 18| 
| row 19| 
| row 20| 
| row 21| 
| row 22| 
| row 23| 
| row 24| 
| row 25| 
| row 26| 
| row 27| 
| row 28| 
| row 29| 
| row 30| 
| row 31| 
| row 32| 
| row 33| 
| row 34| 
| row 35| 
| row 36| 
| row 37| 
| row 38| 
| row 39|
{noformat}
# Preview the page

It happens on Firefox, IE 7 and IE6. the problem happens on those browsers.

Cheers,
fields.summary: Previewing a page does not display long content when Confluence is embedded in a frame

fields.description:
It would be useful for Confluence to provide a BuildNumberCondition which could be used to toggle the display of web-items in different versions of Confluence.

The social bookmarking plugin already has one, but it doesn't correctly handle invalid Confluence build numbers during development. We should use the same parameters as that condition so we can change the social bookmarking plugin to use this condition in the future.

fields.description:
All the following comments are regarding the notation help ( http://..../renderer/notationhelp.action ) 

Under "Advanced Formatting" in the comment section:
* the first line reads "Makes a preformatted block of code with syntax highlighting. All the optional parameters of "panel" macro....." but should read "....of the "panel" macro" since it's referring to a specific macro in context to another one.  (note that I had to remove the curly braces from "panel" in this bugreport)
*Also, in the second comment box, "axes.The" should be "axes. The" (missing a space). 
*In the same comment box, at the bullet "Axis customization parameters", the paragraph ends in "paramters" which should be "parameters".
*In the paragraph above the date formatting guidelines "theyre" should be "they're"
*In the paragraph below the date formatting guildelines, which starts "For parsing with the...", "isnt" should be "isn't"
*In the Graphviz section, a shape is called "ellise", but I assume it should be "ellipse"
*In the "pagetree" section, "hierachal" should be "hierarchal"
*In the "blog-posts" section, 10:th line from the bottom in the comments box, "type.By" should be "type. By" (missing a space) [this is also in "recently-updated" and "contentbylabel"]
*In the "contributors-summary" comment box, 3:rd line from the bottom, "decentants" should be "descendants". [the same goes for "decentants" in the 7:th line from the bottom of the comment box for "contributors"]
*In the "usage" section, fifth line from the bottom of the comment box, "popularilty" should be "popularity"
*In the "plugin-compatibility-matrix" section, "compatibile" should be "compatible"

In "Text Effects", quoteable should be quotable (in two instances)

In "Links", in the second comment box, second line, "apear" should be "appear", and in the sixth line from the bottom in the same comment box, "doublequotes" should be "double quotes"

In "Images", fifth comment box, first line, "pagesthat" should be "pages that"

In the "Macros" chapter for the "Vote" section, the following needs to be amended:

Parameter  |  Required | Default | Description....
(blank)        |  true           |               |  This is the.....paramter     <--- blank should be "vote" and "paramter" should be "parameter"
voters          |  false         |    ....       |  This is a comma seperated ....    <-- "seperated" should be "separated"
viewers      |   false        |    ....         |     (same as above)

In the "survey" section:
* there are three instances of "seperate(d)" which should be "separate(d)"
* "overriden" in cell C4R5 should be "overridden"
* "Dont" in cell C4R7 should be "Don't"

Global for the document:
*In four instances, "preformatted" should really be "pre-formatted".
*In six instances, "dont" should be "don't"

fields.description:
When the search indexing language is set to French, attachment title and page title searching returns different results when a different case of the same search term is used.  Lowercase returns all results, but mixed and uppercase return only a subset of the results.

Steps to reproduce:
# Import the attached space export from 2.10.3
# Change your search indexing to French
# Rebuild your search index
# Search for the terms indicated on the space home page, you should clearly be able to see the problem when searching for "MyEclipse" and "StudlyCaps"

Search of page bodies is not affected by this problem.  I have tested every other indexing language provided with 2.10.3, French is the only language that appears to be affected.

I was able to reproduce the problem with MySQL configured with UTF8 and all the other components (Confluence, tomcat) configured per our documentation.  A customer was able to reproduce on both Oracle and PostgreSQL as well.
fields.summary: Searches have case sensitivity problems when search index language is French...

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-15510].
  {panel}

I hope to have such a feature: List all articles(pages) within a given time range, with options:
* list pages that were created in that time range.
* list pages whose last modified time is in that time range.
* list pages that got modified by someone in that time range(not necessarily last modified).

and with filter options:
* by author: e.g, only pages modified by Mary are listed.
* by space: Only modification occurred in some space/spaces are listed.

The meaning of the feature is: If I remember I record something on Confluence on a specific day and want to revisit it, but I find it hard to search out that document due to various reasons, e.g. too many search result, the search engine temporarily missed that article. So, it's best to *browse* by time range at that moment.

Please consider it. Thank you.
fields.summary: Feature request, list pages by given time range

Currently you can edit an Office document attachment (.doc, .ppt. or .xls) from the viewfile macro and _view_ page (see image below). However, you *cannot* edit the file from the attachments page nor the \{attachments} macro. 
!http://img.skitch.com/20090504-mm64dg5bxq6b3d5ckjtjgfddbn.png!

Can we add a simple edit icon/link next to any editable Office document in the attachments page and the attachments macro? This should be really simple, right? Also, it's confusing that we have the existing _edit_ link since that edits the document properties and not the document itself. Perhaps that should say _edit properties_ instead?

!http://img.skitch.com/20090504-p3w44m6hw8f8wh3bpqjkg6ex7c.png!
fields.summary: Edit Office documents from the attachments page and attachments macro

fields.description:
Enter a status, and press submit. During the few seconds it takes to process the update, the user is prevented from entering extra text, or clicking submit again (CONF-15123).

However - it is still possible to click the 'Cancel' button. This implies to the user that by clicking it, they can cancel whatever they have just submitted as their status update, but this is not correct.

Either the cancel button should work as advertised, or it should be greyed out along with everything else.
fields.summary: Update Status cancel button does not work after the status has been submitted, so it should be disabled

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Cannot use tilde ~ to start a label, yet the warning message is misleading as it does not contain tilde

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add a label "~confluence" to a page

h3. Expected Results
 * Labels get created
 * If usage of ~ is not permitted, provide a warning message that contains the character

h3. Actual Results

Unable to create the label and the following warning is shown:

!Picture 30.png|thumbnail!
h3. Notes

* Creating a label that contains a ~ is permitted. For example "confluence~"
* Tilde may not be the first or only character.

h3. Workaround

 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Cannot use tilde in labels, yet the warning message does not preclude it

Add a page 'Page1' with an attachment 'sample.doc'

Add a second page, and use the Macro Browser to add the {viewdoc} macro.

Enter the page name 'Page1' and select 'sample.doc' from the dropdown.

Previewing will then give the error:
{noformat}viewdoc: The viewfile macro is unable to locate the page "Page1" in space "null"{noformat}
fields.summary: Error message is given when previewing an attachment from a different page
Improve performance of page loads by loading comments without a database join

fields.description:
Add a page, and upload a word file 'sample.doc' using the links browser.

Now use the macro browser to try to add the {viewdoc} macro. The dropdown will be empty, and so the macro cannot be used.

The user has to save the page, then edit again to be able to use these new fields.
fields.summary: Macro Browser OC file field does not work when adding a page

fields.description:
I can't figure this one out.

For some reason the {{color}} on these elements is {{#fff}} even though the actual CSS doesn't seem to set this colour at all.

It only happens on IE7, not IE6.
fields.summary: Menus options are white on white until they are hovered over in IE7

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-15411].
  {panel}

Right now we have:
||Name||  	Percent Used  	||Effectiveness||  	Objects / Size  ||	Hit / Miss / Expired||  	Adjust Size || 	Flush||
|Attachment IDs| 	3% 	|81% |	384 / 10000| 	6257 / 1387 / 0 |	| Flush|

I think it would make more sense to have:
||Name||  	Effectiveness|| Objects/Percent Used  	||  Size  ||	Hit / Miss / Expired||  	Adjust Size || 	Flush||
|Attachment IDs| 	81% |384 / 3% 	|	10000| 	6257 / 1387 / 0 |	| Flush|

Clearly reflecting the relationship of the number of objects in the cache and the percentage used. The *size* should be a separate field. (It is also the only field that is allowed to be tuned via Admin - more intuitive when tuning)
fields.summary: Re-order cache tuning columns in Advanced option

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-15410].
  {panel}

It would be great if one could reset the default cache values :
* Reset all caches
* Individual caches


Also to make it funky, caches that had been assigned custom values could be highlighted in a different colour. So it is immediately visible to the admin.
fields.summary: Allow resetting to default cache values

fields.description:
As part of CONF-11494 we changed how space logos were stored, which meant that they now appear in the dashboard and recently updated macros when changed.

However, the macros assume that all images are attached to a page which is not the case for space logos. This results in this url:

http://bri-bri:8080/confluence/download/attachments/589825&highlight=BSA#null-attachment-BSA

Clicking on the link results in a "Page Not Found' error. Note the "null" where the page id usually is.
fields.summary: Space logo links are incorrect in the dashboard and recently updated macros

fields.description:
+Example:+

* editing in mark up editor - it looks like this:
{code}!picture.png|thumbnail, align=centre, width=50%!{code}

* i am switching to the richt text editor and back to the mark up editor - it looks like this:
{code}!picture.png|thumbnail, align=centre, width=50%%!{code}
("width=50%%" ???) 

* doing it again, an so on - there will be "%%%%%%%" :-(

Viewing the site, is not the problem. - It look fine.
BUT when i export the site with these percents to PDF, the image has only its origin size in the PDF.
fields.summary: switching between editors adds percents to the image width parameter

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-15404].
  {panel}

It should be possible to enable mail nofiticattions for a page and all its sub-pages for:
* new pages
* changes
* removals

Can this be done with some workaround or does this need a change in confluence?
fields.summary: Allow user to watch patches recursivly

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-15403].
  {panel}

*issue:*
We have serveral thousands page per space. If I want to move a page from a specified location (node) to another, i have to wait a _long_ time (a few minutes).  I can't move a page, before the complete tree (all viewable nodes) was loaded.

I think there are two reasons for this problem.

*1. You load all pages (content entity objects) at once.*

- Can it be reasonable, if you don't load all entities at once? (using AJAX for "lazy"-loading?)

*2. The complete creation process consists of three steps!*
 * Firstly, you load all pages.
 * Secondly, you check the permission for each page.
 * Finally, you sort the list of remaining pages by title. (Collections.sort() + overriden equals method)

 - Is there any chance to combine this actions in only one hql statement? (join with permission table and order by?)
fields.summary: Low performance on loading the hierarchical view

fields.description:
Upload a file test.ppt

Use markup:
{noformat}{viewppt:test.ppt|height=<script>alert("xss")</script>|width=<script>alert("xss")</script>}{noformat}

The scripts will be executed when the page is loaded.
fields.summary: XSS vulnerability can be exploited with the viewppt macro

Instant Messenger Macro XSS Vector

fields.description: Right now we create a AOP proxy on every invocation of getCache() outside of a transaction. As the proxy is only used for logging we could as well just create a wrapper class and delegate.
fields.summary: Improve performance of TransactionalCacheFactory

fields.description:
Currently, it is not possible to escape a literal period (.) to search for strings that contain a literal period.  One use case is for searching documentation for "Mysql 4.x".  All variations on escaping the period don't have any effect, the character is either stripped or interpreted as a single-character wildcard.

You can reproduce the problem by searching confluence.atlassian.com for "2.10" and then "2.*".  The first returns documentation related to Confluence 2.10, the second returns anything with the number "2" in it.
fields.summary: Provide ability to escape dot (.) to search for a literal period in a string...
Add the ability for administrators to view the list of restricted content for a space...

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-15374].
  {panel}

There are two aspects to this minor improvement request (which I think could be addressed fairly quickly). Whether both get implemented is probably ultimately not my decision, but imho, the first is more important to address:

1) The +Documentation+ link (on all Macro Browser pages) has no preceding space character, which can lead to problematic word wraps (see attached image).

2) Furthermore, I discussed this with the other T/W's and we thought that the single word +Documentation+ could do with some additional wording to make it consistent with the other context-sensitive documentation links throughout the Confluence UI. The suggestions are as follows (although only the word 'documentation' should be hyperlinked):

* Refer to +documentation+.

or

* More +documentation+.

(In order of preference.)
fields.summary: Documentation link on Macro Browser has no preceding space (resulting in problematic word wraps) and could do with some additional context words.

fields.description:
If you restrict viewing of a page to "Confluence-administrators" when the group is actually "confluence-administrators" (i.e. by manually entering the group name and hitting enter), no warning is displayed, but suddenly the page and all its children are no longer indexed.

I have verified the problem behavior with Confluence 2.9 and 2.10.3 with or without LDAP enabled.

Steps to reproduce:
# Create a page which is restricted to an off-case group that the current user is a member of (such as "Confluence-administrators").  Include distinct content to aid in searching.
# Rebuild the search indexing
# Search for the new page

If there is a valid group or user permission (i.e. with the right case), the page is indexed.  If there is *only* a page restriction with the wrong case, the page is not indexed.

The behaviour is the same when users are added to page restrictions with the wrong case.
fields.summary: Search indexing disabled for pages with off-case restrictions

fields.description: Confluence would be more accessible (and easier to use with just the keyboard) if we had accesskeys for the editor tabs: Rich Text, Wiki Markup and Preview.
fields.summary: Access keys for editor tabs

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-15347].
  {panel}

Due to the lack of support for hibernate.jdbc.batch_size in DB2 and Sybase: 

     http://www.hibernate.org/120.html#A6

We have removed the benefit of JDBC batching processing on all of our databases. For example, some upgrade tasks that do batch inserts/updates/deletes could run faster with batching enabled. 

This does not have to be the case. We can apply the batch setting on a per dialect basis by updating: 

com.atlassian.config.db.HibernateConfig#getHibernateProperties

We can determine the dialect by querying applicationConfig.
fields.summary: Turn on batch processing in hibernate for databases that support it

fields.description:
The {follow} macro does not render the 'Full theme' (large icons) when previewing it either in the Macro Browser or on the page itself in IE7.

However, these large icons are rendered correctly when the page is saved. Unfortunately though when the page is edited again and the user wants to edit this macro, the icons will be rendered small again even though the macro browser and its wiki markup clearly state 'Full theme'.

This problem is not apparent in Firefox.
fields.summary: Follow macro does not render the 'Full theme' (large icons) when previewing it either in the Macro Browser or on the page itself in IE7.

fields.description:
Weblogic 10.x [isn't currently supported|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-13612], watch that issue for more information.

Currently, there is a specific issue with the page tree view, which has been reproduced with both Weblogic 10.1 and 10.3.   Steps to reproduce:
# Install confluence on Weblogic 10.x following the documentation and our [known issues with WebLogic page|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Known+Issues+for+WebLogic#KnownIssuesforWebLogic-DeployingConfluenceonWeblogic9.x].
# Create a space and browse the pages in the space.
# Open the tree view, it will sit and churn without ever completing the page load
# In the firefox error console, a message like the following appears: {code}
Error: data is null
Source File: http://192.168.35.242:7001/confluence-2.10.2-exploded/s/1518/1/1.0/_/download/resources/confluence.web.resources%3Apage-ordering-tree/tree.js
Line: 907
{code}
# In IE 7, a similar error is returned: {code}
Line: 908
Char: 33
Error: 'length' is null or not an object
Code: 0
URL: Error: data is null
Source File: http://192.168.35.242:7001/confluence-2.10.2-exploded/s/1518/1/1.0/_/download/resources/confluence.web.resources%3Apage-ordering-tree/tree.js
Line: 907
{code}

The problem occurs when running the embedded database and an external database.  This happens regardless of the context, the customer reporting this was using the root context and encountered the same problem.
fields.summary: Page tree view doesn't work under Weblogic 10.x
